FuncDef:
The filter-list vni command creates a VNI list and display the VNI list view.
The undo filter-list vni command deletes a VNI list. The filter-list vni command creates a VNI list and display the VNI list view. The undo filter-list vni command deletes a VNI list. By default, no VNI list is created. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a VNI list name.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

ExtraInfo: VNIs, similar to VLAN IDs, differentiate virtual extensible local area network (VXLAN) segments and identify tenants. A VNI represents one tenant, even if multiple terminal users share the same VNI. To create a VNI list, run the filter-list vni command. The VNI list can be applied to an if-match clause to filter EVPN routes.
